arm_group.description: Effects of low-level laser therapy on muscle performance during physical strength training and gene expression of muscle tissue.
Effects of physical strength training without low-level laser therapy on muscle performance and gene expression of muscle tissue

brief_summary.textblock:
Muscle performance is largely influenced by modulations in gene expressions of muscle
      tissue. In this context, low-level laser therapy has been used to improve muscle performance
      in experimental models and human researches. Thereby, the investigators examined modulations
      on global gene expression of muscle tissue influenced by exercise associated to low-level
      laser therapy.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Low-level Laser Therapy on Global Gene Expression of Young Males Submitted to Physical Strength Training

detailed_description.textblock:
This study assessed muscle performance in isokinetic dynamometry and leg press device;
      global gene expression of muscle tissue by microarray analysis

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  healthy males aged between 18 and 28 years;

          -  body mass index (BMI) equal to or less than 26 kg/m2;

          -  moderated pattern of physical activity

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  previous injury to the femoral quadriceps or hamstring muscles (within 6 months prior
             to study),

          -  osseous or articular disorder in the lower limbs,

          -  cardiovascular system disorders,

          -  systemic disease, and

          -  taking prescription medicines or using dietary supplements such as muscle mass
             builders

clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Low-level Laser Therapy on Global Gene Expression of Young Males Submitted to Physical Strength Training

other_outcome.description: Immunohistochemical analysis to quantify morphology and cells of muscle tissue as satellite cells.

oversight_info.authority: Brazil: National Committee of Ethics in Research

primary_outcome.measure: Global gene expression by microarray analysis

reference.citation: Ferraresi C, de Brito Oliveira T, de Oliveira Zafalon L, de Menezes Reiff RB, Baldissera V, de Andrade Perez SE, Matheucci Júnior E, Parizotto NA. Effects of low level laser therapy (808 nm) on physical strength training in humans. Lasers Med Sci. 2011 May;26(3):349-58. doi: 10.1007/s10103-010-0855-0. Epub 2010 Nov 18.

Vieira WH, Ferraresi C, Perez SE, Baldissera V, Parizotto NA. Effects of low-level laser therapy (808 nm) on isokinetic muscle performance of young women submitted to endurance training: a randomized controlled clinical trial. Lasers Med Sci. 2012 Mar;27(2):497-504. Epub 2011 Aug 26.
